application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: San Francisco, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA
description:
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.

Equally adept at working strategically as executing on our vision, the Content and Knowledge (C+K) team strives to ensure Google users can find the right information in the right place at the right time, all the time. We manage and maintain high quality, up-to-date, impactful collateral and knowledge and partner closely with a diverse set of stakeholders. We work hard to understand the content needs of our users and supply easily discoverable content for the global Sales Knowledge system.

The C+K team sits within the Global Productivity and Sales Tools (GPST) team, responsible for leading tools strategy and operations. GPST resides within the Go to Market Operations (GTM) team and enables Google’s Business Organization (GBO) to drive customer success by nailing the now and setting the path for the future. Experts in driving process improvements and consistency, team members are analytical and strategic with a pragmatic sense of getting things done.

The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Advertising sales experience.
  • Experience with content management/production systems, service operations, and/or web development.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Ability to build relationships and work effectively cross-functionally.
  • Ability to influence and persuade others without direct authority.
  • Analytically-minded, logical thinker with exceptional problem solving skills.
responsibilities:
• Manage the global knowledge base for the global content management system for Google’s Ad Sales.
  • Partner with our product and solutions experts, Sales teams,  Marketing, and Sales Operations to craft strategy for the Global Ad sales knowledge supply chain.
  • Manage a team in order to help execute on your content strategy and vision.
  • Audit our knowledge platform to ensure it offers the breadth and depth of content needed to support key use cases driven by the business priorities.
  • Structure and execute multiple cross-functional projects simultaneously by developing plans, gathering and synthesizing relevant data, leading analyses, and developing final recommendations.
title: Sales Knowledge Manager
